importantArticles.headline: Free high-speed Wi-Fi available exclusively to AAdvantage members beginning in January 2026 on more planes than any other domestic carrierDALLAS and FORT WORTH, Texas, April 15, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- American Airlines and AT&T — two iconic American brands built on a legacy of connecting customers to the people and places that matter most — will take those connections to new heights, offering complimentary inflight Wi-Fi¹ across more than 2 million American flights a year, beginning in January
importantArticles.title: Connecting the world: American Airlines to provide complimentary inflight Wi-Fi, sponsored by AT&T

importantArticles.headline: The deal with AT will provide free in-flight internet to loyalty program members, beginning in January.
importantArticles.title: American Airlines to Provide Free Wi-Fi, Joining Race to Court Connected Travelers

importantArticles.headline: Brad Smith takes a closer look at the trending stories on Wall Street as part of today's Market Minute. Netflix (NFLX) stock gains on reports the company is aiming for a $1 trillion market capitalization and to double revenue by 2030. American Airlines (AAL) is partnering with AT&T (T) to offer AAdvantage members free in-flight wi-fi. HPE (HPE) is in focus as activist investor Elliott Management builds a $1.5 billion stake in the company, according to reports. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
importantArticles.title: Netflix wants to double sales, American Air free wi-fi, HPE & Elliott

importantArticles.headline: All major indexes and blue chip stocks are down for the year in the stock market, leaving investors searching for safer investments to lean on during this time.  One to consider is AT&T (NYSE: T), which has trended in a positive direction, up over 15% year to date and more than 56% in the past 12 months.  After an impressive run -- especially for a company whose share price struggled for years before the recent turnaround -- investors might wonder if AT&T's stock is still a buy or if they missed the boat.
importantArticles.title: Is AT&T Stock a Buy Now?

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- Verizon Communications was upgraded to “Outperform” by Evercore ISI, which named it its top pick in the wireless sector, citing improving subscriber trends, fiber growth potential, and a compelling valuation following years of relative underperformance.
importantArticles.title: Evercore calls Verizon top wireless pick on fiber, valuation as it upgrades stock

importantArticles.headline: AT&T (T) has received quite a bit of attention from Zacks.com users lately. Therefore, it is wise to be aware of the facts that can impact the stock's prospects.
importantArticles.title: Investors Heavily Search AT&T Inc. (T): Here is What You Need to Know

importantArticles.headline: As the stock market swings wildly thanks to erratic, unpredictable, and potentially economically damaging tariff policies from the Trump administration, predicting anything in the near term about stocks has become next to impossible.  AT&T (NYSE: T), Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) (NYSE: BRK.B), and IBM (NYSE: IBM) are three such companies that investors can buy and hold for the long run.  Telecom giant AT&T will certainly feel some pain if the Trump administration's tariff policy leads to an economic slowdown.
importantArticles.title: 3 Top Stocks to Buy and Hold for 20 Years
